That day was “the preparation of the passover‚’' a day of high solemnity‚ and when it behoved the priests and the other fathers of the Sanhedrim to be present at the third hour in the Temple, and to offer their Ghagigahs that were preparative to the whole seven days’ festivity: but they em- ployed themselves in another thing, namely this. You may observe that he saith not, “it was the third hour when,·” but “it was the third hour, and they crucified him.'' That is, when the third hour now was, and was passed, yet they omitted not to prosecute his crucifixion‚ when indeed, ac- cording to the manner of the feast and the obligation of reli- gion, they ought to have been employed otherwise. I indeed should rather sit down satisfied with this interpretation, than accuse the holy text as depmved, or to deprave it more with my amendment. But,
